columns.name: network_interface_id
columns.description: The ID of the network interface.

columns.name: status
columns.description: The status of the network interface.

columns.name: interface_type
columns.description: The type of network interface.

columns.name: description
columns.description: A description.

columns.name: availability_zone
columns.description: The Availability Zone.

columns.name: owner_id
columns.description: The AWS account ID of the owner of the network interface.

columns.name: association_allocation_id
columns.description: Allocation id for the association. Association can be an Elastic IP address (IPv4 only), or a Carrier IP address.

columns.name: association_carrier_ip
columns.description: The carrier IP address associated with the network interface.

columns.name: association_customer_owned_ip
columns.description: The customer-owned IP address associated with the network interface.

columns.name: association_id
columns.description: The association ID.

columns.name: association_ip_owner_id
columns.description: The ID of the Elastic IP address owner.

columns.name: association_public_dns_name
columns.description: The public DNS name of the association.

columns.name: association_public_ip
columns.description: The address of the Elastic IP address bound to the network interface.

columns.name: attached_instance_id
columns.description: The ID of the attached instance.

columns.name: attached_instance_owner_id
columns.description: The AWS account ID of the owner of the attached instance.

columns.name: attachment_id
columns.description: The ID of the network interface attachment.

columns.name: attachment_status
columns.description: The attachment state.

columns.name: attachment_time
columns.description: The timestamp indicating when the attachment initiated.

columns.name: delete_on_instance_termination
columns.description: Indicates whether the network interface is deleted when the instance is terminated.

columns.name: device_index
columns.description: The device index of the network interface attachment on the instance.

columns.name: mac_address
columns.description: The MAC address of the interface.

columns.name: outpost_arn
columns.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Outpost, if applicable.

columns.name: private_dns_name
columns.description: The private DNS name

columns.name: private_ip_address
columns.description: The IPv4 address of the network interface within the subnet.

columns.name: requester_id
columns.description: The ID of the entity that launched the instance on your behalf (for example, AWS Management Console or Auto Scaling).

columns.name: requester_managed
columns.description: Indicates whether the network interface is being managed by AWS.

columns.name: source_dest_check
columns.description: Indicates whether traffic to or from the instance is validated.

columns.name: subnet_id
columns.description: The ID of the subnet.

columns.name: vpc_id
columns.description: The ID of the VPC.

columns.name: groups
columns.description: Any security groups for the network interface.

columns.name: ipv6_addresses
columns.description: The IPv6 addresses associated with the network interface.

columns.name: private_ip_addresses
columns.description: The IPv4 address of the network interface within the subnet.

columns.name: tags_src
columns.description: A list of tags that are attached to the network interface.
